meanings.definition: To compare in order to show differences
meanings.sent1: She contrasted the two paintings to see how they were different.
meanings.sent2: The teacher contrasted the two stories to help the students understand better.
meanings.sent3: The chef contrasted the sweet and salty flavors in the dish, creating a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality contrasted sharply with his serious demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the flowers contrasted beautifully with the green leaves.

meanings.definition: To set in opposition in order to show differences
meanings.sent1: The politician contrasted his views with those of his opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The artist contrasted light and dark shades in the painting to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully contrasted their favorite colors, teasing each other about their choices.
meanings.sent4: The silence of the library contrasted with the noisy chatter outside.
meanings.sent5: The old building's architecture contrasted starkly with the modern skyscrapers around it.
